reviewText: I'm pleased with my purchase as it is pretty and very comfortable. Ring is true to size. I'm excited to have a ring that won't turn, unlike my white gold sets. I work in healthcare so I am constantly using hand sanitizer or washing my hands.

Really like this ring. It's simple obviously, but I'm a mother who's constantly washing hands and sanitizing everything. It was destroying my regular wedding bands. So, this was a nice substitute, does not fade, tarnish, or bend. So, I can still show that i'm married but in a pretty more flattering way. :)

I can't believe what great quality this ring is. We eloped and only had a very limited time to buy our rings, and when we were browsing jewellery stores many of them didn't have the correct size or we felt the rings were outrageously priced. A quick amazon search drew me to this ring and we couldn't believe the quality of it when it arrived. We were going to 'upgrade' our wedding bands once we had more time after eloping but my husband likes this so much he's decided to keep it!

Looks like platinum and it's very durable.  You really can't tell it's not expensive at all. I bought two for my husband so he can wear whenever he's finger get swollen or shrunk.  Most of all is super comfortable to wear.

Quick delivery, looks great as a placeholder wedding band next to my platinum engagement ring (colors match nicely)! The size 6 I ordered here is slightly smaller than the size 6 diamond ring I got from the jeweler, which is great because I can use this band as a ring guard.

Update: I ordered a second ring, size 5.5 this time, to wear as a ring guard for my slightly-too-big engagement ring. Now I wear the size 6 band shown here, stacked behind my engagement ring where it belongs, then the 5.5 on the outside to snug everything into place. It works great as a fitting fix, and because this band is so fine and understated, it doesn't look too heavy even though I'm now wearing three rings on my wedding finger. Very satisfied.
summary: Great color match with platinum; ring guard success!

reviewText:
Ring looks same as how it was advertised which is a major plus from some of the reviews I've read. Over all I am pleased, I'm new to wearing a ring and not sure what style I am going to like so I figure I would buy something similar in style to a more expensive ring I'm considering to see how I like it. One thing to note is that the interior is convexed so it's a little tighter than actual size. For example I'm a 12.5 but on a ring sized it's a smig smaller. Also one thing to note that in the light it is truly bright white but low light is a gray white.

Other than that not much more I can say, it will do its job until I figure out what my final ring will be and after that this will be something I wear when I travel.
This ring looks amazing. I had tungsten already, but did not like the gray color anymore. I highly recommend the white tungsten over basic tungsten. Quality is great and delivery was fast.

Absolutely great experience working with this company. I haven't worn the rings yet so I cannot vouch for durability and such. The color is (at least to me) identical to white gold and a nice polish/shine look. I have ordered 4 (2 different sizes for my future spouse and 2 different sizes for myself), non customized. It was shipped directly by Amazon, arrived in China in 3 days (for only 20USD!!!). I then returned those rings (via EMS china, which was way more troublesome than UPS) to order the engraved one (and smaller thickness as i found 5mm was too thick for me).

Rob didn't make any issue to refund me the rings (despite my returned package being stucked for two weeks at the China EMS office). I received the engraved ring in no time and they are of great quality. The only (minor) flaw that I find to these rings are the MJ Metal Jewelry engraving inside each of them, I would have prefer not to. Otherwise, I recommend 100%!
Fits as expected!

I just received my ring today but it is much nicer than I anticipated. I ordered a titanium ring on Amazon a week before and I only got it yesterday. There is a huge quality difference between the two. Works great as a replacement wedding band until my fingers go back to pre-fat size. I may even order another one if I lose this extra weight, I like the look better.
Perfect to wear everyday while working with your hands. It always looks shiny.

reviewText: I love this ring! I bought it to wear in lieu of my engagement ring on days that I have class because I often deal with nasty chemicals in lab. For those who are wondering, it is darker than my white gold engagement ring. It does run a bit small, so if you're in between sizes, choose the larger size.

Love this ring. I've had it for 2 months now and it still looks like new. It retains its polish well and feels "smooth" on my finger. By far a superior choice to Titanium. I had a Titanium ring previous to this one and I only lasted about a month before it looked "worn out".

Can't beat a tungsten carbide band, especially for anyone who works roughly with thier hands on a regular basis. I got the regular tungsten carbide band for my husband & he loved it, very durable but he had the bright idea to test it's durability by clamping a vice grip on it & when he released it it put a chip & visible hairline crack in it & since then has mentioned that it scratches him so as part of his valentines day present I decided to get him a new wedding band & of course I wanted another tungsten but I wanted it to more closely match my own wedding set, that's when I discovered the white tungsten carbide & it's perfect,  I love how bright silver it is instead of being dark like the regular tungsten.  I hope he loves this one just as much as the first,  hopefully he won't get any bright ideas this time lol & it'll last for years to come.

Very nice ring. I would say true to size based on what you were sized at the jeweler. I bought this to replace my original white gold wedding that I can't seem to find, that was a size 8. But right off the bat, this ring looks better and feels more expensive for a fraction of the cost of that white gold band. I wanted to go a little bigger since I have another thicker 8mm tungsten ring that is a size 8, snug fit but a bit tight so I felt I wanna go a little bigger. According to online size guides based on circumference I'm a sz 10. So I figured a size 9 is good. Nope. Too loose. If anything I shoulda stayed at size 8 or went half a size bigger at 8.5, so to sum it all up, if you don't know your size, measure the circumference of your finger, match it with the size guide, and go down 1.5 to 2 sizes down. Hope this helps
summary: Sizing guide for those who do not know, or forgot their size

reviewText: Good quality and feel

I bought this to use as a wedding band for a trip to Central America. I wanted something not too flashy that would signify that I am married. Given that my fingers swell and my skin is sensitive to many metals, I also wanted a metal that would be non-reactive in sweaty conditions. This ring is PERFECT! It is SO COMFORTABLE that I no longer wear my original wedding ring, even now that I am back in the US. And, it is the only ring I wear every day. I have had NO reactions to the metal, at all. The only "issue" I have with my ring is the size - I didn't know my ring size and so I ordered a size too big. I didn't really see a good sizing chart when I bought it. Because of this, I wear it on my middle finger, not my ring finger. The good news is that when my fingers are swollen, it still works on my ring finger.
summary: THE ONLY ring I wear EVERY DAY!

I chose white tungsten because the 14k white gold wedding band I've been wearing for just nine months cause ring rash.  The white gold band I had chosen had a lot of nickel in it, which is normal and used as a binder when making rings, but the quality of the gold overall was poor and faint brown blemishes appeared.  My husband had chosen a tungsten carbide ring and it has remained in perfect condition so far so that's why I chose to go with the same metal.  The white tungsten carbide is beautiful and matches my white gold engagement ring perfectly.  I will always recommend this metal now to others.  On top of that, the ring rash continues to heal even after wearing this new ring immediately.  Regular tungsten is a bit darker so go with white tungsten if you're trying to match it to white gold or platinum.  Also, it shines like crazy.  I love it.

We are both very pleased with the appearance, fit, and comfort of these rings. The white tungsten carbide is shiny and spotless, with an appearance similar to chrome. The rings are not grey in color. Reflections in the ring are crystal clear! The WTC engravings are neatly done. The comfort fit of the rings is nicely noticeable, and each has an overall relative heft and size for great comfort, feel, and appearance. Received both rings within 3 days of order with regular shipping -- ordered at the same time. Smaller ring was nicely boxed (size 9 by 3 mm). Size 10 by 4 mm ring came in plastic bag with small velvet pouch. This was a nice touch as it appears the seller assumed the smaller ring was for the lady and should be boxed for gifting. We both wanted simple bands that would stay nice looking and stand up to daily scuffs and bumps, and we can afford to lose them. I can't respond to day to day wear of the rings as they have not been exchanged formally, yet, but TC is tool steel and known for being quite hard and tough. RVD.

I ordered both at the same time. When they arrived, I found mine was the correct size, but did not match my wife's ring. The product description had originally said "comfort fit" but mine had relatively harsh edges inside and was measurably thinner than my wife's ring (1.3mm vs 1.6mm).
The vendor quickly responded to my query, explaining that the 3mm ring does not come in a comfort fit, and thanked me for bringing the error in the web page to his attention. He offered to replace it with a 4mm ring with comfort fit.
The new ring arrived today and is exactly what I was hoping for. I dropped the 3mm ring in the mailer and sent it back. Painless.
And now we look more proportional--she has the 3mm and I have the 4mm.

One other note, the color in the product photo for this ring appears warmer than it actually is. The photos were probably taken in warm light, so alongside all of the other tungsten rings the others look more chrome like.

In reality, this ring appears exactly like standard automotive chrome, somewhat bluish. It looks just like many of the other chrome-like rings you see on a search at Amazon.
See the attached photo where I set the ring on top of the chrome corner of a guitar amp.
summary: Beautiful ring, great customer service, color is like chrome, less warm than product photo

reviewText: Very nice ring!

I tried on wedding bands at some of the local retail stores and found tungsten carbide to be my favorite of the metals due to its hefty weight and high scratch-resistance. Their tungsten rings were priced between $150 - $200+ and were the darker grey color of regular tungsten carbide, which I did not like.  When I came across this white tungsten ring at Metals Jewelery I was instantly sold.  I an still shocked that I got this ring for just a hair over $20, and I have Amazon prime so I got it with free 2-day shipping. It looks virtually identical to white gold and is a comfort-fit ring with a high polish. In my opinion, there is no better option than this and no better value in a men's wedding band anywhere around. The 700+ high customer ratings pretty much says it all.
summary: Excellent men's wedding band - did not disappoint.

reviewText: I picked this up to wear on a Boy Scout camping trip after my nephew lost his wedding band a day after his wedding while out kayaking with his wife. I had been looking for an alternate wedding band so I could work on projects and engage in rougher activities and not worry about my ring. One day while wrenching on a lawn mower wheel, the wrench slipped and I ran this ring right into the concrete floor.  Well I thought, glad I didn't have my gold ring on as that would have left a gold streak on the floor if not a few diamond chips as well.  So l started to look for the mark that it made on this ring and didn't notice anything.  I figured it was because of grease or dirt on it.  Later that night after I had a chance to wash it, I looked again and could not find any marks from the scrape on it.  I know tungsten is known for being hard but wow. If you are in the market for a nice looking, tough ring, that is low cost.  This is it.
summary: White tungsten beats them all.  It has a very nice silver appearance to it without the grayness regular tungsten rings have.

reviewText: Excellent communication
A very high quality ring! It looks like white gold and is a strong metal. The well polished shine keeps it looking elegant. I highly recommend this ring!

I bought this ring as a temporary replacement ring when pregnant, when I developed a temporary allergy to the metal in my wedding band (platinum) and my fingers swelled so much that I couldn't wear the band comfortably anyway. Since it wasn't meant as a permanent replacement, I wanted something cheap but still durable. This ring fit the bill! The white tungsten is very shiny, and even after wearing it for about a year (took a while for my fingers to return to normal), it looked as new as the day I first put it on. I was very impressed with the quality of the ring, especially since it was so cheap. My husbands wedding band is also made of tungsten, but was purchased at a jeweler and cost over $400! So if you are worried about sacrificing quality for cost, fret no more.

As far as comparisons with white gold are concerned, I have included pictures with this band side-by-side with my engagement ring, which is white gold (taken over a year of wearing the band). The white tungsten is slightly darker in color, but it is not readily apparent unless you really look closely. Of course, the rhodium plating on white gold will wear off over time, so it won't always stay as pristine as the white tungsten will.

This was a great purchase, and I would most assuredly get it again.
summary: Perfect for a non-adorned wedding band

These rings are great but I wish they would make a slightly less domed design. The white tungsten finish is beautiful, more understated than cobalt chrome (but without a hint of the usual tungsten grey) and actually more resistant to scratching, to my shock.

If you buy a ring like this that's wider than probably 5mm, you will want to add a half size to your regular ring size. I normally wear a 7 but have a couple of widths of these in 7.5 for days when I'm retaining water. That's the beauty of this metal -- you can have several widths and a couple of different sizes without spending a fortune. Aside from the fact that this stuff doesn't scratch like either gold or silver or even stainless steel.

The "carbide" part is important. Don't just buy cheaper rings that only say "tungsten". Tungsten carbide says "No, you" when contacting surfaces that normally damage jewellery. Also, when faced with a pressure causing it to fail, it will shatter instead of bend, increasing the chances of keeping your finger in an incident.

It does have a slightly darker hue than stainless steel, white gold and silver, but it's not super noticeable unless it's directly compared. However, it holds a much nicer shine in my opinion and it DOESN'T SCRATCH. We love it.

reviewText:
With the popularity of tungsten carbide rings with a range from a few bucks to hundreds of dollars, you can never really know what you're buying until it's received. I buy so many items thru Amazon, I don't always have time to do reviews unless the items are either exceptional values or tremendous failures. This item falls into the exceptional category. Being fairly harsh on my wedding bands over my four decades of marriage, I have had some of the best values offered as well as a few irritating wastes of time and money.

At the price point for this ring, I wasn't expecting much. On receipt and inspection, the fit, finish and quality of this item truly rivals that of rings costing a couple of hundred dollars or more. To the average eye, it is truly indistinguishable from a retail jewelry store piece. Only time will tell if the initial qualities are enduring but after only a few days service, it remains literally as received as to appearance. My last item of this type was a titanium band from a jewelry store costing over six times the price of this yet it was already scuffed in under a week.

Feel confident in buying this ring at this price point. Its visual brilliance and comfortable beveled fit make it a winner. If it remains this way for any reasonable time, I will be purchasing a "backup" just in case. It really is that good of a deal!
summary: I have had some of the best values offered as well as a few irritating wastes ...

It did not seem like a safe way to transport the product, but there was no damage done. It does come with a small velvet pouch which is nice. The ring is true to size. I wear a 5.5 and I purchased a 5.5 and it fits perfectly! Nickel is used as a binding agent so if you are allergic to that be mindful of this purchase. So far I have had no issues.

reviewText: My husband and I had a quick backyard wedding nearly two years ago. We had talked about what kind of ring he might like and he told me about Tungsten Carbide. We aren't hugely traditional people so neither of us had "official" rings for over a year! It wasn't a huge deal for us to have them because hey, we know we're married and the people who matter around us know this as well. Well, for Christmas this last year I decided to get him a ring. Sadly he doesn't have any other rings so I had to tell him I was getting him one (so no surprise sadly!) and try to figure out his size. Well, I ordered too big BUT the seller was FANTASTIC and let me exchange the ring for a smaller size when I told them it didn't fit (since you can't resize these). I'm SO happy with my purchase. reviewText: This is the ring that I wear around the house in place of my wedding band set so that I don't ruin the beauty of my wedding set with menial tasks. This ring is simple but holds up well against household chores, heavy lifting, yard work, heavy duty and dirty tasks, etc. I wear it every time I'm at home because I don't want to accidentally have one of the gems in my wedding set be knocked out or fall out due to the abuse that can happen every day in the home or yard (even washing dishes can ruin a ring set by making the stones dull and wearing the plated polish thin-or even scratching the malleable gold or silver) --I know two women that this has happened to and their wedding sets had to be replaced because the stones fell out and became lost. So, I took the precaution of purchasing this ring as a household replacement and it's great. No scratches, nicks, dings, bent areas, and it still shines as brightly as the day it arrived. I've been wearing it for months with no problems. I only gave 4 stars because it does the job I purchased it for and I like it for that reason, but as a woman I can't say I "love it" (a 5 star rating) because I like a bit of sparkle-that's just me. If you're a woman that prefers simple, or a man looking for something durable, I highly recommend this ring. :)

I really love these rings. This is my second one I've owned. The reason I purchased two is I lost the first one - it was a half size too big. You cannot get tungsten carbide rings resized. But I like the look, feel, and weight and you can't beat the cost. Similar rings in retail brick and mortar stores can cost 4, 5 and even 6 times more, but still far less than precious metals. So if you lose weight or are careless in getting your ring size correct, replacement will probably not break the bank.

I just want to add that my choice of tungsten carbide over a precious metal like gold had to do with my personal statement about the Holocaust. During World War II, when the Nazis sent millions to their death, the confiscated the jewelry of the victims and use that precious metal to fund their evil causes. If ever another evil power like the Nazis come to power where I live, I don't want to contribute to their endeavors.

There's a barely perceptible light-blue cast to this metal, which shows up more under fluorescent lights. In whatever light it's in, it looks really beautiful -- clean, flawless, and bright but not quite as flashy as cobalt chrome. I have no idea why anyone would throw away money on a gold band when there are so many more durable alternatives. It's too bad more jewelry isn't made with this metal.

Edit: I got married in June and had been wearing it since then (it's September now). It's just as shiny and hasn't picked up any dents, scratches, or other marks. My only problem is that I seemed to have developed an allergy to the material of the ring. My finger began to itch and I developed a bumpy rash. However, this isn't necessarily something wrong with the ring itself; just a thing that happened when my body reacted in a weird way.
summary: I'm allergic, but that's not the ring's fault.

reviewText: I'm back here thinking about re-purchasing this band. I bought it about a month and a half ago but returned it, I decided I wanted a black tungsten ring. This ring was honestly perfect. I left it on in the shower, I wore it to work a busy weekend at a fast food place. I put this thing through it's paces for sure. NOT ONE TINY SCRATCH AT ALL. I examined it very closely and carefully as I was NOT going to return a damaged band, but it wasn't even scuffed. I was sad to see it go, but I wanted a black ring to match the one I got for my husband for our 10-year anniversary. I thought, "I can't have TWO anniversary bands..." Hold on a minute. Says who? This isn't a terribly expensive ring. It's an excellent price and a lovely classic band, which I'm pretty partial to. For my little lady fingers it is just the right width to wear alone or even stacked with one or two other similar width rings. I HATE bulky rings that bang my knuckles or snag on things, and this one never did. Okay, I've gone and talked myself into it, I'm buying another one. Hey, my birthday IS next week... :-)
Perfect!
It is beautiful! Great value.
Very shinny.

So far I'm very pleased with it, though I've only had it short while. It looks beautiful. The weight is substantial and it feels good. If my opinion of this ring changes, I'll update my review, but for now I think it's great!

reviewText: Great product and great customer service.

I started looking for wedding bands about a year ago and was shocked at the prices out there.  I wanted a simple, plain, silver or white gold band and they were upwards of $500.  I came across the White Tungsten Carbide rings on Amazon and saw all of the amazing reviews, but was super nervous to order my wedding ring on Amazon.  I can honestly say that I made a GREAT decision.  I originally bought the 4mm band (which I exchanged at my wedding) but quickly realized that it was a bit too thick for my liking.  The 3mm band was thinner and looked better on my finger.  This ring is super comfortable and I've been wearing every day for about 2 months now.  It still looks perfect, no scratches or dings and everyone thinks that it's a silver or white gold band.  I buy a LOT of things on Amazon and I never thought I'd say that I bought my wedding ring here, but I love it and it's a steal.  Don't spend big bucks.  Try this first.  You'll love it.

Purchased this ring and in less than 2 months it is starting to tarnish or fade in color doesn't appear to be good quality at all. Has spots all over the ring. Totally dissatisfied with this purchase...

I was looking for a narrow band, and this fit the bill perfectly. The comfort fit is amazing. I am 60 years old and had never had a comfort fit ring on before. Love it. The color of the ring is beautiful--very similar to my mother's platinum band. Great price, good looking, and comfortable.
Really nice and shiny, good quality
Looks really shiny and pretty and fits great!  Bought it to wear daily instead of my white gold band because I'm now allergic to gold.  Hopefully the ring will last for a very long time.

I did a lot of research and visited quite a few jewelry stores shopping for white tungsten wedding bands to replace the rings we lost. These rings are exactly as described, and absolutely beautiful!! They are true to size and look fantastic on us! I have never had experience with tungsten and I was skeptical, especially since they are so much more expensive at jewelry stores. I'm thrilled I finally decided on these and highly recommend them!
I love this ring! It's exactly what I wanted. I'm wearing it in place of my wedding rings due to some weight gain after the birth of my 2nd child.

It's super durable and has a great shine. The sizing is right on as well. I love that it is more of a skinny band since I have smaller hands and a plain band is usually too clunky on me. This one is perfect!

Fit good I have huge hands so the 6mm widtg is good but if I had regular or smaller hands I'd probably go with a 5mm. Seriously looks like white gold for the guy who isn't into flashy jewelry this is a good classic ring, the tungstan has a heavy weight to it so it feels more like gold also, plus in an emergency it can be put in a vice and will come right off, can't go wrong for a mens engagment ring at this price
Came just as expected- nice ring that looks just as nice as more expensive versions, but for an affordable price.

just got it in the mail. fits good. very slightly a lil big, but i like it that way. i don't like rings that feel like they're squeezing my finger. the PERFECT size i guess would be about 12.5. i can shake my hand, and try to pull it strait off my finger and it doesn't come off easily. it is nice and shiny like the picture, feels so polished it almost feels slick. i bought this to replace my favorite one i lost. i don't remember what the last one was made of but it was almost impossible to scratch. i even had a berry from welding stick to it and it popped off with no damage to the finish. IF, IF this ring is the same stuff i expect it will be just as durable. And at  a fraction of the cost, the last one was also an online purchase, $100. i would have given 5 stars but i don't know how scratch resistant it is yet.

This 4mm ring I leave on all the time and I pretty much forget it's there. In both cases (4 & 6mm rings) the rings look like new, no scratches or tarnish on the rings even though I do a fair amount of rough work while wearing them.

Had the classic gold band for many years. Was on a shoestring budget back then so it wasn't ultra thick even when new. After all the years of wear, my original gold band had become even thinner and quite sharp around the edges. After consulting with my better half we decided it might be a good time to retire it the original before it got snagged on something at work and removed my finger. The white tungsten ring was the route we took. I have owned and worn this ring 24/7 since December and I can't find a scratch on it. I went with a size 11.5 (probably could have gone 11) and it is very comfortable. The ring is heavier than my original, but considering how thin my old one had become, anything would be. The edges are comfortably rounded and my wife and I both think it looks excellent. If I were to misplace it, I would not hesitate to purchase another. Great price....great ring!

I got this for my work wedding ring. I am a AEMT with a busy EMS service and rings easily get trashed.  I have been wearing this ring to work for almost a year now and am very pleased with it. My ring size gets a little smaller during the winter months. That led me to purchase this ring at a half size smaller than my platinum wedding band. The color of the white tungsten carbide is really great! It is not the dingy grey that I would normally associate with tungsten carbide. It looks more like white gold, or freshly polished platinum. At this price, I don't need to worry about something happening to it. It will make a great ring for when I go on vacation and am worried about losing my real wedding band. I liked it so much that I bought another one in my regular ring size. It is well worth the money. I could not be happier with the purchase. I have only been wearing it for a few weeks, but there are no signs of wear. I would also like to note that I have a nickel allergy and my skin often reacts to white gold. I have been wearing this 24/7 and have had no reaction.
summary: For the price, it's hard to beat!

Very nice just what I was looking for

I expected this ring to be nice, but I had no idea it would be THIS NICE. So it far exceeded my expectations! And continues to do so.  It's a beautiful color ring, that looks and feels like something I paid a lot of money for at a high end jeweler's. It honestly matches my white gold pieces, so perfectly! I've been wearing the 5mm on a daily basis and this is the first ring I don't need to take off while showering, cleaning house, doing dishes, etc. It just stays beautiful all the time, and it still shows no visible scratches. Since they are made to shatter if dropped, I try not to take it off. Even still, accidents can happen. So because I never want to be without this ring, I've already ordered another 5mm as a backup, as well as a 3mm to wear for days when I want to wear my solitaire. My solitaire will fit with the 5mm, however because my solitaire is set in a wide white gold band, I wear the 3mm on days when I wear my real diamond band. I really can't say enough about how nice this ring is. I highly recommend!!!

Great wedding band. I have fairly thin, boney fingers (size 8.5) We had bought a bulkier 6mm beveled-edge tungsten carbide ring prior to our wedding.  It was okay for the first few days but it wasn't going to work for me being a machinist.  I needed something more comfortable and less bulky. This ring is awesome.  So comfortable I forget I have it on.

I love this ring! I'm a nurse and don't want to wear my regular ring to the hospital, and this is the perfect replacement. I've worn it almost constantly for about a month, and even with constant hand sanitizer and soap, it hasn't lost any of its shine. Since it's white tungsten, it matches my white gold and sterling silver jewelry perfectly. I recommend this for sure.

EDIT: Okay, after wearing it for about two months I changed my review from 5 stars to 3 stars. My finger breaks out in a rash after I wear it for a week. So I can only wear it for a few days at a time and then I have to let my finger heal. Just know that if you're sensitive to cheap jewelry this might break your skin out. I don't have a problem with silver or gold, but I guess tungsten is more allergenic.
summary: Great ring! Matches my white gold jewelry

reviewText: I love this ring. It looks nice, the size was accurate and it arrived early.

We purchased this ring as a wedding band for my husband. He works with his hands all day long, so we didn't want to spend a lot of money on something that would inevitably get scratched. At 5mm, it's just the right width, and he loves it. The quality of metal is really quite amazing! He's been wearing it for 7 months now, and there are virtually no visible scratches- even after working with pungent pool chemicals and heavy machinery. I don't believe he's ever had it professionally cleaned because it looks just as new as when we had purchased it- even after it's been covered in engine grease! If you're like us and want something that's durable, attractive, and inexpensive (because let's face it: he's going to lose it at some point), then this is it!
Nothing negative to say..

Ring shipped very fast. New and in a nice blue little pouch. No wear at all whatsoever and very shiny. But then, the ring IS Tungsten Carbide and, you know, you can't scratch that stuff even if you tried with a hammer. Fits perfectly. Size was exactly what I ordered.

It looks like the morally good version of the One Ring though. Seriously, besides the obvious color differences and the tiny inscription on the inside telling you what metal it is made of, it looks exactly like it. Nice and weighty too.

FUTURE BUYERS BEWARE THOUGH: Tungsten Carbide can NOT be refitted, retooled, etc. Or at least not without the fires of Mt. Doom. (AKA 5,100 degrees Fahrenheit) Once you get it, for better and worse, that's exactly how it's gonna be and it's not going to budge a ****ing inch for the rest of time. That's why even though my exact ring size was 7 1/2, I got it at 8 to accommodate for any future weight gain and/or growth.

Top shelf product, top shelf service,  As advertised, durable, heavy and much, much cheaper than Platinum which my wife wears. I am a Strength Coach/Trainer in a large gym and am handling knurled barbells and dumbbells all day and it stands up to that abuse perfectly. Nice to get something that lives up to expectations.
summary: Nice to get something that lives up to expectations

reviewText: This ring is very simple, clean, and exactly what I needed.  It looks very similar to the ring I'm wearing at the moment, except mine was about $200 at a normal jewelry store.  You won't be disappointed!

reviewText: Beautiful ring.

Wow. Just wow. My wife recently had a scare where she thought she lost her 18k wedding band, and so we started looking for low cost replacement bands. We were considering either tungsten carbide or titanium. The main advantages of tungsten is it is the hardest metal and can only be scratched by diamond. Also it is much heavier than titanium and even gold.

The rings look and feel fantastic. My wife and I love it.

reviewText: Perfect!

He wears it all the time and has hardly even been able to put a scratch on it and it's still as shiny and new looking as they day we got it!. Any ring that can withstand the abuses of being on my husband's finger is all right by me. Save your money, skip the white gold and go with tungsten, you won't be disappointed.

So, I did want to report that it does actually scratch but they are hard to see. With gold you could buff the scratches out. I'm pretty sure you can't do that with tungsten carbide. I'm leaving the five stars on the review even though there are several very fine scratches on the ring now.

It looks a lot like platinum or white gold to me. I have had it for a few months now and it doesn't show even one scratch yet. It fits great and is very comfortable. They might not be available here any more then. I see that a lot on things I find such a good deal on. Anyway, it will be nice to just go into the lock-box and pull out the backup if I ever need it. For 21.00 it is cheap insurance. I did some comparison shopping at a few jewelry stores and they all came in over a hundred dollars more and I didn't like them as much as I like this one. reviewText: This is the first tungsten ring--or piece of jewelry--that I've owned. I bought it as a temporary replacement for a white gold ring I lost, but from my experiences with it so far, I think this may stay permanently. The ring is shinier than my previous white gold ring, and it's definitely less susceptible to scratches. I was afraid that it would be to thick, but everything about it is just right!

Edit 3/11/17 - I have worn this ring everyday for just shy of a year. When clean, it is still as beautiful as when I first bought it. It holds its own quite well against jewelry store SS and white gold rings which are exponentially more expensive. The blemish I mentioned.. well it must have been me just being picky and wanting my wedding band to be perfect. It's still there, but I don't notice it nearly at all anymore. Upgrading review back to original 5 stars because of its longevity. I don't expect to replace this ring in this life time.

Original review: Beautiful. If you're on the fence about getting this ring... Do it!

But as first impressions.. I am in awe of this ring. Being able to purchase inexpensive quality rings  meant we could get the photographer that we wanted for our very low budget, DIY wedding. So pleased, blessed, and excited.

Update: upon closer inspection, the ring has a blemish on it, circular discolored spot that I didn't notice before. I still like the ring and will be keeping it.. But I couldn't give it 5 stars because it was quite noticeable.

reviewText: These rings are a fantastic bargain.  I bought a matching pair for me and my wife, since we both work in fields where we get our hands dirty, and an intricate ring with grooves and ornaments could be a liability.  Mine remains really nice and shiny after more than a year of daily wear, with only barely perceptible scratches visible under magnification.  It has no sharp edges, and is therefore comfortable, and it has a nice dense feel of precious metal.  Delivery was fast and it came in a cute little felt drawstring bag, like smugglers in movies always carry their uncut diamonds in.  This ring looks and feels absolutely as good as gold or platinum, is more durable, and costs next to nothing.
summary: Better than gold for practical people.

reviewText: This is an amazing ring that has the look of a silver or platinum ring for a fraction of the price. It is well worth the price and is more durable than any precious metal you can find.

First some background... I work in construction, and have been notoriously hard on my wedding bands.
  I started with gold bands, and literally broke a couple of them (and I mean broke, clean through), they were sold for their gold weight. I then went for years without a wedding band (apologies to my wife). Then titanium rings came on the market. I bought one, and pretty much destroyed it in two weeks. It didn't break, but it looked awful. Again I went without for a couple of years. Now  these tungsten carbide rings have come around. After the years that I have spent in construction, I have learned some things about metallurgy, and was intrigued.
I  thought I would give it a try.
  Now to the ring.
  Okay, first of all, this thing is a beast. The first thing you will notice is the weight. It feels substantial (like gold). The next thing you'll notice is the feel, it is smooth!!! This ring has held up to my rough treatment phenomenally well. On close inspection, I can't see a scratch on it.
  If you live a rough, and active lifestyle, I would highly recommend this ring. One bit of advice, this was the  first comfort fit band  I have  bought, and I think because of the smooth rounded surfaces, it felt loose.  After a couple of tries I  ended up with  a size 11 ring, whereas my previous non-comfort fit ring was a size 12... Not to worry, the return and exchange process is simple, and I ended up with a ring that fits perfectly. I love this ring, and my wife liked it enough, that she asked me to order one for her as well.
summary: Gorgeous,  and unbelievably tough, just like my wife.

Love the tungsten carbide rings!  Got this one for my wife so she could wear it everyday instead of her gold wedding band.  Gold is nice and all, but it scratches and dings so easily.  The great thing about the tungsten carbide rings are that they NEVER scratch or get dinged.  Certain welding processes use tungsten carbide electrodes because the melting point is so high, they won't melt in the presence of the arc.  These rings are so durable and look so nice, it is hard to believe they are priced so low on Amazon.  I mean, I get that tungsten carbide isn't a precious metal, but their durability and quality are very worthy.  The best part about the low price is that if you are someone prone to losing your ring, then losing these rings won't put a damper in your budget.

We both wear our rings 24/7 they are very comfortable and we don't even notice that we are wearing them. If I happen to lose anymore weight in my fingers I will not hesitate to get another one of these rings in a smaller size. They are great rings to get if you do not have a ton of money to spend or don't want to spend a ton, they are also great if you are not big on wearing much jewelry.

Such a good deal, I had to try it. My husband's black tungsten ring is very heavy... But it's a guy's ring so it's bigger. This 4mm band doesn't feel noticeably heavier than a gold or silver band would. The finish is beautiful. I want to say there's a slight almost baby-blue cast to it that's really only apparent under fluorescent light -- but it's NOTHING like the greyer-tinged metals. It's bright. It seems to wear well (just a week, but 24/7 wear) -- no scratches. It's comfortable and not overly domed or overly thick (as in, skin-to-surface, not the 4mm measurement), yet it's substantial. I'm really glad I tried it, instead of continuing to search for the cobalt chrome I wanted.

Update, 5+ weeks of constant wear later: The finish on this is outstanding. I've looked at the back part of the bands of all my rings, and basically all of them, gold or silver or stainless or what-have-you, have tiny mars and scratch marks. This wide shiny ring that touches everything I touch... it's as unmarred as it was straight out of the box. I don't even know how that's possible.
It came very early and looks very nice. It is a little small but it's wearable. Really like it.

I am really glad I bought this ring. I wanted something to wear at work that wouldn't tear my gloves when I walked in a patient's room. This ring is not only simple and pretty, but is also very comfortable. I don't like a lot of rings and this one I forget I'm wearing it. I was also very pleased with the quality. It is a good size for a female to wear by itself. It is a little bulky if I pair it with my engagement ring (has an enhancer on it). My engagement ring is white gold, and there is a slight color difference between it and the color of this ring. I notice it, but I'm not sure that others would.

Its a great ring but here's my warning: People will ask you why your ring is so shiny and it leads to chit chat about the weather. If you don't like talking to cashiers and garage sale vendors about your ring and the recent El Nino patterns, it's best to stay away. I've been very impressed with the product.
summary: Perfect For Chatty Individuals, Married Folks

reviewText: I am a student nurse and this is perfect. Quality is great and I don't have to worry about anything (ex; gloves ripping while handling specimen). Highly recommended. Fast shipping.

Perfect look for a fraction of the price.  I lost my ring about a year after marriage when I left it on a truck I was loading at UPS for work.  I've just gone without since.  For our tenth anniversary, we went to a jeweler to get a new band for me and a band for her.  The jeweler sized us and then offered up the prices for gold..."So, that would be $280 for yours and $550 for his, since it doesn't use as much gold." "Ah, yes, that makes sense," I said. "Holy crud! Gold is THAT expensive?!?" I silently thought.  "What about tungsten rings?" I inquired.  "Oh, we don't use, what we call, modern metals because they cannot be resized.  If you buy one of these, then if you ever need it resized, it can be done."

Well, I came home, looked it up on amazon and bought this one for about $20 or so...But what do I do if I grow out of it!?! It can't be resized!...oh right, it cost 20 bucks...I buy another one.  Heck, buy all the sizes...it'll still be cheaper.

The ring looks great!  I've had it for months and never take it off.  It's been in the pool, the ocean, through yard work, and in the dirt.  It has no scratches and looks just as shiny as the day I got it.  All in all, a wonderful ring.

reviewText: I received my ring yesterday. And I am very impressed! I have heard a lot of good things about the  white tungsten carbide rings. I went to my jeweler and priced a 7mm white tungsten carbide band and I almost fell over when he told me the price. 265.00!! Well I wasn't going to pay that for the simple fact that if it didn't work out I would be stuck with something I could not wear. That's when I went to my old friends at Amazon.  I found this ring and decided to give it a try. So glad I did. I have had it on since I received it. Even though it is a heavy ring, it is amazingly comfortable. It feels like silk on my finger. ( if that makes sense, lol). So far, I love this ring. I wanted a band that I can wear constantly if I want without having to worry about it scratching or dulling in shine.  And I believe that I have found it. I highly recommend this ring. As far as the size goes, for me, the size 6 is true to size. It fits snug without being real tight. I bought my first of ring in June. I'm getting married in September so I haven't even worn it yet, other than trying it on to make sure it fits. It's sat in the black "sack" that it was shipped to me in. I pulled it out to show a friend recently and noticed that it has some discolourations on it. They're slightly darkened areas that almost resemble burn marks. Not extremely noticeable, but still a disappointment because now I'm past my return policy and am stuck with it. Luckily it was cheap and I still have time to find a more suitable ring before the wedding. I suppose I can keep this ring to wear when I'm in situations that I don't want to get my next ring lost or harmed.

The issues continue... I decided to try this one more time because I really don't dislike this ring, if only it weren't discolored. I tried ordering 1 more only to later realize that they didn't come to me from Metals Jewelry, but from "Gnex" in China. This 2nd ring was lighter in weight and just felt cheaper all-around. The first ring had a classy "White Tungsten Carbide" stamp on the inside... the 2nd ring had a blurry/sloppy "White Tungsten Ring" stamped on the inside. Thanks for the permanent reminder that this is a ring, I guess?

I guess I should have paid more attention when I purchased, but it seems strange to me that the products shipped from Metals Jewelry and Gnex are so different, but being sold under the same name. Also, when I ordered from Metals Jewelry I got Prime shipping and free returns; ordering from Gnex meant I had to pay for return shipping and only get a "partial" refund. Be careful of that.

So far it seems like the comparably priced "Oxford Ivy" Tungsten rings are a way better bang for the buck and way more consistent in quality. I'd recommend those instead of this ring. They're more silver/grey in color, but better value.
summary: Discolored spots & slightly different products sold under same name.

reviewText: I bought this version for my wife and the larger 5 mm version for me as our wedding rings. We've had them about a month now, and thus far are very satisfied. They arrived as described simply packaged in just a plastic bag placed in a small cloth pouch. At first, my wife was hesitant to wear the ring often, because she was afraid it would be scratched or nicked. But I explained to her the material was tungsten carbide, which is one of the hardest ring substances out there, and one of the best priced. Thus far, neither of our rings show any sign of wear at all after more than a month of use, which is what I expected and hoped for. They're comfortable to wear, and to me at least, almost have a shiny, light reflecting coloration that looks like stainless steel, which is fine. The coloration of the ring is not dark at all, and in fact, on our fingers, looks much lighter and more shiny/reflective than the photos posted on the Amazon listing.
summary: Very nice wedding rings at a great price, satisfied so far

reviewText: I couldn't make up my mind between Tungsten and Titanium. Decided to do some research and apparently, Titanium is better for the long term use.  Titanium is strong but not scratch proof. Tungsten is actually scratch proof, being the hardest metal on Earth and all. But the downside is that it is not strong so it could shatter or crack with just one drop. I need my ring for a few years until it is replaced with a real gold one so despite getting a few scratches over the years I am going with Titanium.

It has a good weight to it, which I like, and the inside is slightly curved which makes it even more comfortable. I often forget I have it on, and have slept with it on.

reviewText:
The ring is slightly whiter than the picture which I like. It's completely mirror-like to the point where you could shave by looking in it. The comfort fit feels very nice. The ring is heavy and feels very durable. Im thoroughly impressed. For the people leaving negative reviews because it's "too wide," it clearly states how wide it is in the description. Don't hurt the sellers rating because you're too lazy to get a ruler.

***UPDATE***
After two weeks, the ring has began to scuff/scratch. They're pretty small, but still noticeable. Tungsten is NOT scratch proof and this is perfectly normal. It is however, MUCH more scratch resistant than any other metal on the market. Overall, I am still very happy with my purchase. It's perfectly imperfect, just like a good marriage.

reviewText:
I purchased this as a replacement for a lost wedding band (cue sad music or sad trombone, if you're more devilish in your sense of humor) and I am impressed. Most tungsten gives off a gray shine that is fine but this looks like a white gold band and has held up already to a few incidental knocks and brushes up against other surfaces.  I would still encourage you Ringbearers to occasionally part with your Precious when you are swimming or using strong chemicals but otherwise it's solid, shines brightly and holds up well.  The sizing is also accurate based on other rings I tried on but remember that comfort-fit bands, particularly in tungsten should be ordered a half to a full size smaller than the jewelry store.

Another thing I have to say is the price was fantastic.  I could order several of these in different sizes if I were but less sane and still spend less than a "good" plain gold band.

I'm giving it 5 stars, because I do really like the ring. I would like to warn any potential buyer that the ring sizes run a bit large. I finally ended up with one size lower than what I normally wear. However Rob in customer service was very prompt in getting me a return ring, 5 stars to him as well.
Love this ring!!! My husband was surprised that it was Tungsten because it looks so much like a white gold band.

Bought this for my wife to wear when she does not want to risk damaging or getting her diamond and white gold wedding band dirty.  it fits true to size and has not scratched at all.  It's a little darker than the picture, but not the "gun metal" dark like other tungsten rings.  It is slightly darker than white gold and makes a great alternative to white gold.  I am 100% satisfied with this purchase and would recommend this to anyone looking for a cheap, durable white gold alternative.

I have a 14K white gold wedding band that after only two weeks of wearing to work had become incredibly scratched, so I decided to look for something else to wear while working to preserve my gold wedding band.  I found this as a cheap option and decided to give it a shot.  I have been wearing this to work everyday for almost a month now and I am completely satisfied with this purchase.  There is not a single scratch on it! It is darker than the picture, but not the "gun metal" dark like traditional tungsten.  Actually, it is only slightly darker than my white gold band.  I ordered a size 9 and it fits just like my size 9 gold band.  If you are looking for something cheap, durable and resembling white gold, then I would recommend this 100%.
summary: Cheap, durable and great white gold alternative!

reviewText:
After getting sized at a local jeweler, I ordered in my size and received the item promptly.  Unlike other buyers, however, I felt that the ring ran a bit too large.  After measuring the inner diameter, I found that the ring size measured exactly as it should; the problem that I had was that the slickness of the polish, combined with the comfort beveling, made the ring come off a lot easier than the ring sizers they use at the jeweler's.

I wouldn't call this a problem with the ring--just a matter of personal preference:  I don't want the ring to spin or wander along my finger, especially as I like to work with my hands.  Luckily, adjusting down half a size from what the jeweler recommended solved the problem :)
summary: Great ring!  Polish and bevel made it fit more loosely than I expected, however.

I bought my first of ring in June. I'm getting married in September so I haven't even worn it yet, other than trying it on to make sure it fits. It's sat in the black "sack" that it was shipped to me in. I pulled it out to show a friend recently and noticed that it has some discolorations on it. They're slightly darkened areas that almost resemble burn marks. Not extremely noticeable, but still a disappointment because now I'm past my return policy and am stuck with it. Luckily it was cheap and I still have time to find a more suitable ring before the wedding. I suppose I can keep this ring to wear when I'm in situations that I don't want to get my next ring lost or harmed.

The issues continue... I decided to try this one more time because I really don't dislike this ring, if only it weren't discolored. I tried ordering 1 more only to later realize that they didn't come to me from Metals Jewelry, but from "Gnex" in China. This 2nd ring was lighter in weight and just felt cheaper all-around. The first ring had a classy "White Tungsten Carbide" stamp on the inside... the 2nd ring had a blurry/sloppy "White Tungsten Ring" stamped on the inside. Thanks for the permanent reminder that this is a ring, I guess?

I guess I should have paid more attention when I purchased, but it seems strange to me that the products shipped from Metals Jewelry and Gnex are so different, but being sold under the same name. Also when I ordered from Metals Jewelry I got Prime shipping and free returns; ordering from Gnex meant I had to pay for return shipping and only get a "partial" refund. Be careful of that.

So far it seems like the comparably priced "Oxford Ivy" Tungsten rings are a way better bang for the buck and way more consistent in quality. I'd recommend those instead of this ring. They're more silver/grey in color, but better value.
summary: Discolored spots & slightly different products sold under same name.

We got these because of the reviews and because we both work in environments where chemicals and abuse are expected. After wearing this on the job sites and the hospital for over 3 months now, we are axed at how good they still look and are holding up.

More than likely we will buy more. I've dropped mine in the disposal twice now and I need to just go ahead and get a 2nd for me for a slightly snigger fit or for when the disposal is on when the ring falls off.

I think this is by far the best inexpensive ring you can get for the money. Bought another very similar but after only a day it was scuffed and scratched. This is holding up so much better I will only buy from this vendor to be sure I get the same thing.

I like to wear silver colored jewelry (whether silver, white gold, or platinum), so this is a nice addition.  Main reason for purchase is that we are planning some international trips in a few months, and I don't want to take any expensive jewelry.  This ring looks great and is very comfortable.  It looks nice and compatible with my platinum diamond ring.  The color is slightly different from the platinum, but not really noticeable.  I could wear this with the platinum if I chose to do so, and I don't think anyone would notice the difference.  Only time will tell how this metal wears....but for now, for $23, I am very pleased!

The color is a close match to white gold, you'd have to look very closely to notice the very slight difference. I only wish the 2mm also came in size 3, but I'm happy with this as well. I also love that I do not have to worry about scratching them, or that they would be very costly to replace if anything does happen to them.

One of the best value purchases I've made on Amazon (or anywhere else, for that matter) in many moons. Highly recommended.

reviewText: This is a white tungsten carbide ring that I bought for my father in law to replace a yellow gold band he had for a very long time. The original gold band had become bent over the years and he was looking for something "more modern." We talked him into trying tungsten because it is a very pretty, shiny metal that is resistant to scratching. He works outside a lot and needed a ring that was both durable and stylish.  He has had this ring for 4 months now and he LOVES it! He wears it daily and it has held up beautifully. The ring itself is very high quality and heavy.  No scratches or dings. The moment I took it out of the box I dropped it on ceramic tile and it bounced all over the floor. Another reviewer had said his ring cracked when dropped, so I watched it bounce around on the floor in horror!  The ring was fine, no cracks or scratches from dropping it. This ring has a shiny finish and fits true to size. It looks much more expensive that it really is. Overall, I would recommend this product!

You won't mistake this ring for fine jewelry, but for some folks this is ideal. Both my owl and I picked the wrong ring size, even though we measured each other with a tape. We bought two more rings that are the right size for us and suffered no long-term financial damage. As well, we won't stress if we lose these rings.

For what they are, all four of our rings are flawless. If your wife can accept a tungsten carbide wedding set, congratulations. You have chosen well. The rings are a good choice too!

If you are looking for a very traditional looking tungsten ring that looks very similar to a white gold wedding band then this is what you need. This has a very high polished look and a solid heavy feel to it. I looked at some of these types of rings in stores and they typically run around $100. I believe that this same exact ring at a retailer would be around that same price. I recommend that you cut out the middleman and save yourself a lot of money. I would say the only drawback is that tungsten is a little bit heavier than the other metals which for some people is a bonus and not a drawback.

If you have not yet researched tungsten then the main benefits are the price, the extremely scratch resistant nature, and the ability to remove during a emergency because it can shatter relatively easily. The main selling point to me was the very scratch resistant nature. Many other metals scratch fairly easily so they will not look immaculate after months and years of wear.

The drawbacks to tungsten are the heavier weight, the fact that tungsten rings can shatter if dropped from about 7 feet above the ground onto concrete, and for some people the lack of prestige because it is much cheaper to produce tungsten.
summary: if you're looking for a traditional looking white tungsten ring, then this is the one

reviewText: All my husband wanted was a simple, classic, durable wedding band. We did some research and found that Tungsten was probably going to be the best metal since he is in commercial construction. We went to a bunch of jewelry stores and all their Tungsten rings were thick and fancy. We finally were able to find a thin, shiny band that he loved... super comfortable and everything but it was over $200!!! When we got home I found this ring online and it appeared to be exactly what he wanted but it had to be too good to be true since it was under $25. Based on the reviews, we bought it. We were not let down. It arrived very quickly (the day before expected) and was true to size. We were expecting the ring to be pretty dark because of some of the comments like "gun metal color". It really wasn't dark at all and was super shiny. Honestly, I couldn't have told the difference between it and white gold by the color but I'm not a jewelry appraiser. Just out of curiosity we held it side by side to a white gold band and what do you know... slightly darker (and I had to squint to really notice) but that was really splitting hairs. We were thrilled with our purchase and our $175 savings. One small thing is that I wish we would have ordered a slightly thicker band (like a 5mm or 6mm), the 4mm is a tad thin for a man's hand in my personal opinion but my husband was so happy that it didn't really matter to him.
summary: Perfect wedding band for somone in commercial construction.

reviewText:
I hate wearing rings (another reviewer somewhere phrased it as feeling as if her fingers were being "choked."  That's it exactly).  So when my partner and I decided to tie the knot, the discussion of rings came up and I was resistant.  However, the last time I shopped for a ring, sterling silver was about the only game in town.  This time around titanium was mentioned, and while I liked the description of its very light weight, I was turned off by the complaints everywhere of how easily it scratches.

I reluctantly turned to tungsten, which supposedly didn't scratch but was also very heavy.  We decided on this ring due to several reviewers claiming they forgot they were even wearing it.

They arrived yesterday and so far I'm pretty happy.  My partner's had to be sent back for being too big, but mine fits fine and I'd say "true to size" based on the jeweler's ring sizer I bought off eBay many years ago (sort of an odd tool for someone who hates wearing rings to have, no?)  I love the "comfort fit," which my old silver ring certainly didn't have -- this means a nice rounded edge that feels super smooth going on and off.  And whereas I won't go so far as to say "I forget I'm even wearing it," the weight is there but it's not objectionable.  I typed all day yesterday and it didn't slow me down.  I imagine over time I will eventually stop noticing it altogether.

Some differences from Amazon's photo:  Good:  It doesn't actually say "white tungsten carbide" inside, which leaves more room for engraving.  (UPDATE:  The other night I was examining it under a very bright light looking for blemishes (still none).  But I was very astonished to see it DOES have this inscription, but so tiny and faint it's easily missed.)  Bad:  It's not the soft satiny color pictured on my monitor, but rather the more bluish whitish bright color seen on most wedding rings (see photo).

It's still very pretty though, and feels nice and solid, not cheap at all.  I've got big chunky fingers and usually wear men's sizes, but the 4mm seems perfect and I can't imagine anything larger.  I also can't imagine why anyone would spend hundreds on a ring when this option is available.  I'll update with regards to wear and tear, but so far it seems to be very nice quality for the price.

UPDATE:  It's been a few weeks, and I couldn't be happier I chose tungsten.  I can still feel I'm wearing it, but it's not annoying.  I've been pretty merciless -- I've scraped it on concrete (accidentally), banged it on glass, even changed some oxygen tanks last night at work (lots of metal-on-metal action).  It's still as flawless, spotless and shiny as the day it arrived.  No signs of tarnishing either, which is more than I can say for the sterling silver.  I feel certain a titanium ring would be scratched all to heck by now and look horrible.  This is the much better choice.
summary: Nice ring, for someone who hates wearing rings

reviewText: I purchased this ring to wear daily, because I kept destroying my white gold ring. This ring is comfortable, looks great, and is virtually indestructible. It fits true to size, and the price was outstanding. I'd definitely recommend this ring.

As a woman, I love my gorgeous diamond wedding ring. But I'm leery of wearing it when I'm taking care of things like washing dogs, working with horses, or gardening, because then it gets all dirty and nasty, and is a pain to clean. So I decided to get a cheap plain band to use as a "beater ring", when I'm working with my hands all day. This ring was a great purchase! It is super comfortable and seems pretty indestructible. It probably isn't as shiny as when I first bought it six months ago, but it doesn't have any noticeable marks on it. The sizing was accurate, and it fits the same as my wedding band.

I needed this for an everyday ring that wouldn't get in the way when dealing with children, working out, etc. It fits those needs perfectly. I also have sensitive skin and have had absolutely no issues whatsoever with itching, breaking out, etc. What a deal!
summary: Good everyday ring for busy mom!

reviewText: I love the ring, it is awesome. It looks just like the ones they sell at High End jewelry stores. Except about 90% less $$$$!!!!!!

Wife paid little over 300 for my first wedding band regular tungsten carbide and it has lasted 8 years of construction without a hitch...  This is a brighter white slightly brighter than the photo depicts and we like this better.  The last tungsten ring still looks great.  Really had no reason to change except to go with a wider band... anyone on the fece between tungsten and any other finish who actually work for a living should consider tungsten.

I can't speak for longevity, but the ring arrives with a great finish, mirror reflection without being dark like tungsten or titanium can often be.  My ring is a size 11, 6mm wide (as mentioned in the product description), and 2.4mm thick.  By most standards this would be considered a "Thicker" ring and not low profile.  The ring is nice, but I'd prefer a low profile ring that you barely notice is there when working with tools, playing sports,  or playing an instrument.  I'm going off of these sizing guidelines I found online.  1.8mm-2.3mm for "Standard" ring thickness, "Thinner" or Low Profile 1.4mm - 19mm, "Thicker" 2.2mm - 2.5mm.  I haven't found a budget Tungsten ring where thickness is advertised.  After a few lengthy searches online, it looks like you have to get closer to the $300 price range for full ring dimensions usually in alternate metals.  Hope this helps, good luck with your own research.
summary: Size 11, 6mm wide X 2.4mm thick, nice bright finish

reviewText: These rings are simple, comfortable and beautiful! My new wife and I are not the gaudy, put a few thousand dollars on your finger type people. Plain and simple are how we like it and these rings were perfect for that. After receiving them, I put them away for the proposal. When the day came, I proposed (Thank God she said "yes!"), we eloped and we put them on. Quickly, we discovered that they were the wrong size but it had been awhile since the original purchase! I contacted the company that sells them, telling them of MY mistake, not theirs. I corresponded with Rob of Metals Jewelry who was polite and darned efficient and despite my mistake, happily and very quickly, replaced them! ANYONE looking for simple, beautiful jewelry should use this company as they have a quality product and incomparable service! Thanks, Rob and everyone at Metals Jewelry!

reviewText: the ring description says, White Tungsten Carbide...it looks like stainless steel and it has no markings inside the ring. It also is not true to size, it's a size 7, but feels a little tight. If only in actuality it was as described, I would keep it.

I had purchased the 4mm version of this ring last summer; and over the holidays it became my favorite ring; and now I wear it constantly on my left hand to designate that I am totally committed/married to CHRIST.  My birthday is at the end of this month, January, and I decided that for my birthday, I would order this ring in a 7mm.  I was anticipating a thinner ring when I opened this ring and immediately I was disappointed to see a thick-looking men's ring.  But from past experience with tungsten --- I knew to wear the ring for several days before I evaluated it.  From a "weightiness" standpoint there has been much improvement in the newer tungsten rings.  I am able to wear this tungsten ring without any numbing of my little finger or fatigue in my wrist.  However, I take this ring off when I go to bed at night (I wear it on my right hand).

I had a 9mm tungsten ring that I wore for a whole month without taking it off to discover a callus had developed on my finger.  I am now hesitant and cautious about wearing the wider widths (6mm-9mm) for too long of a time.  There is REAL concern for women in buying tungsten rings.  If you are buying for wedding purposes ---- "go narrow" would be my best advice.  4mm suits me fine for everyday wear without taking it off.

White tungsten (especially with this mirror finish) is God's precious blessing of our age in coming to understand that Jesus wrote the Old Testament.  Here is my meditation for this ring:

IN CHRIST --- IN TRUTH RING
Mirror-finished White Tungsten
When you know The Word was written by Him.
This realization,
This fruition,
Is the discovery that the truth lies within.
To find Christ's temple
Is to look in the mirror --- it's that simple!
Gwen Newclear The Poet
summary: IN CHRIST --- IN TRUTH RING --- God's precious blessing to Our Generation

reviewText:

My first thought was this:  Had I known before I ordered this ring that it was now possible to have a thin tungsten ring --- I would have ordered a wider width.  (However, today I absolutely love it just the way it is:  4mm).

The beauty of tungsten rings is that they do not scratch; they remain looking "BRAND NEW" after long term, everyday wear. reviewText: I bought this to use with several rings I inherited from my mother.  They are about a half size too large so I wanted to use this Tungsten classic  band to hold them in place on my finger.  The size was a perfect fit, the color is outstanding, and the ring is extremely comfortable to wear.  It also is very close to perfectly matching the sterling silver rings, and not a bad match with my white gold.  In all, I love this ring!

I was skeptical about the looks and durability of this ring, but I have to say that this thing is not only very shiny and classy looking but it does NOT scratch. Not only will this ring not scratch, but it is very unlikely to scratch other surfaces with it's smooth finish.  Another benefit of this ring and reason for purchasing a smooth surface ring is that it is much less likely to scratch other things it comes into contact with. My other tungsten carbide ring has a brushed finish and is dull in color. While that other ring is still attractive, it will scratch any painted, leather, or plastic surface that it rubs against. I am very particular about my vehicles so I quit wearing that other ring when I determined a few scratches on my door pillar and wear on my steering wheel were being caused from that "other" ring. Since wearing this ring, I have not seen any scratches appear on anything.

I work with my hands constantly while working on industrial equipment. Although I should remove my ring for safety reasons, I don't always remember to so and I am often reminded that I am wearing a ring when I hear metal parts or tools banging or rubbing on my ring. Every time I look to see if it is scratched I am amazed that it is completely flawless. The last incident involved a large rat tail file that was rubbing on my ring while using it. There wasn't a single scratch on the ring!

Did I mention that it looks good too? Perhaps it may be a little too shiny for some guys, but I really like it and it. It reminds me of chrome on my motorcycles. I get a lot of compliments and many people ask me if it's white gold. They are surprised when I tell them it's white tungsten carbide. A lot of people have no idea what that is. There are other rings that claim to be white tungsten carbide but they have a grey tint to them. This one looks like white gold folks! No grey tint to this one and it looks great. When I hold it against my wife's white gold wedding and engagement rings, it matches except mine doesn't have any scratches and won't have to be re-dipped over time. It cost literally fractions of pennies on the dollar as compared to hers. I would recommend this ring to anyone looking for a band style ring with all of the real life working features a man who is "hands on" would be looking for.
summary: Beautiful ring that will NOT scratch. (It doesn't scratch other surfaces easily either :)

9/27/14 update:

I took my heavily-worn Tiffany platinum (PT950) ring, brushed the finish with green Scotch Brite, and then used the tungsten carbide ring reviewed here to polish the platinum by rubbing the two rings together.  This taught me three things:

1) This ring can be used to polish platinum to the point where it looks shiny and new

2) This ring can't be scratched by rubbing it against roughly finished platinum

3) Once platinum is fully polished, it looks a lot like this tungsten carbide ring!

With the platinum worn, it looks brighter than this tungsten carbide ring.  But polished, they look nearly the same brightness:

https://farm4.staticflickr.com/3888/15196464008_8963b41384_b.jpg

It's a much more subtle difference than I thought.

Love this ring.

Original review below:

I decided to give this ring a try.  It's quite beautiful.  I can't remember my platinum wedding band (worn for the last 15 years) ever looking this polished.  It's also extremely comfortable.

That said, I was hoping it would be as white as my platinum band, and it's definitely darker to my eye.  Here is a pic:

https://farm4.staticflickr.com/3850/15172294789_d54f1a872b.jpg

For me, it's too dark.  Will keep it as a spare but I doubt it will see much use.

Still, I'm giving it 5 stars because it's the same color as the picture they show and delivers what I ought to have expected.

Amazing quality for such an inexpensive item. Can't really tell the difference between this and a highly polished white gold/platinum ring costing hundreds of dollars. Do order a half size smaller than normal as the "comfort fit" slides very easy over the knuckle.
summary: Amazing quality for such an inexpensive item

reviewText: I love it!!!
item as described.  Arrived on time.

I ordered two 3mm rings for myself in two sizes to try, in 7 and 7.5, since some reviews said that these run small. I also ordered a 5mm version of this band for my fiancee in a size 6.5. The 5mm band was comfort fit, the two 3mm ones were not. The 3mm run small, the 6.5 5mm comfort fit is a little loose on my fiancee's finger but my 3mm size 7 fit him better, so when these rings ship non-comfort fit they probably run almost a full size small. The size 7.5 feels a little more snug than my size 7 engagement ring.

Despite this inconsistency, the rings are gorgeous and mine almost perfectly matches my newly refinished white gold engagement ring. It is only very slightly darker and it is only a noticeable difference upon very close inspection. In my reading, tungsten carbide rings are 4x as hard as titanium so they are very scratch-resistant, which means the beautiful finish lasts a lifetime. Unlike some metal rings, tungsten carbide can be removed at a hospital in case of emergency: they can crush it in a vice and most hospitals carry the equipment necessary to do this. This is just an extra bonus in a wedding ring in my mind.

These rings are not re-sizeable, but that's okay with me since a gold or white gold band costs around $50 to re-size when you can just order another one of these in a new size for $20.

I am happy with my purchase, I just wish they didn't advertise non-comfort-fit rings as comfort-fit, especially since there are size discrepancies.
Edit: We have had these rings for several years now and they are as bright and shiny as the day we got them.

reviewText:
Background:  Prior to buying this White Tungsten Carbide wedding band, I owned a regular gray tungsten carbide wedding band.  For whatever it is worth, I thought that the  regular gray tungsten carbide ring was fine.  However, my wife thought it looked a little too "industrial".  Portions of the regular tungsten carbide ring were dark gray, and she said that it was not the prettiest color.

Initial Reaction:  After doing some research, I decided to try one of the new White Tungsten Carbide rings.  All I can say is WOW!  I got the white tungsten carbide ring in the mail today, and it is really VERY nice looking!  It is not "white" like a piece of paper.  Rather, it looks very much like a highly polished white gold ring.  It also has a nice heavy weight to it.

How It Is Made:  Here are the technical facts regarding white tungsten carbide...  The ring is composed primarily of gray tungsten carbide and nickel. A coating (predominantly chromium and a platinum group metal) is applied to the ring using physical vapor deposition. The vapor deposition provides superior adhesion as compared to traditional plating techniques. The white tungsten carbide ring will maintain the brilliant 'white' finish of the coating due to the hard scratch resistant [predominantly] chromium coating and the improved adhesion between the coating and substrate.

Bottom line:  This ring has the advantages of a regular tungsten carbide ring, and the look/feel of a white gold ring.  Based on what I have read, white tungsten carbide is not quite as scratch resistant as regular gray tungsten carbide.  However, white tungsten wedding bands are MUCH more scratch-resistant than Titanium, Stainless Steel, or gold wedding bands.

Final Thoughts:  If there are any problems or issues with this ring, I will provide an update to this review.  In the meantime, I think you will really like it if you are looking for an inexpensive wedding band that is much more durable than a traditional gold ring.  But the usual 'work rules' still apply...  If you are working on heavy equipment or if you are handling strong abrasives like bricks or ceramics, take off your ring!  Better safe than sorry.

Update:  After owning & wearing this ring for almost two years, it is still 100% scratch free and the color/finish still looks perfect.
summary: This is the Ring to Buy!!!

But the color of the ring was very dark, couldn't wear it with other silver rings. Even if it's white tungsten, you can't combine it perfectly with silver. Had to return.

Still in the process of the return, but it looks like there is no problem to return with this seller.
